t: Amos 5
Seek the Lord and Live
Hear*p this word that I take up over you in lamentation, O house of Israel:
“Fallen,*pn no more to rise, is*ld the virgin Israel; forsaken*ln on her land, with*ld none to raise her up.”
For*p thus says the Lord God:*s “The*pn city that went out a thousand shall*ld have a hundred left, and*ln that which went out a hundred shall*ld have ten left to*ld the house of Israel.”
For*p thus says the Lord*s to the house of Israel: “Seek*pn me and live;
but*ld do not seek Bethel, and*ln do not enter into Gilgal or*ld cross over to Beersheba; for*ln Gilgal shall surely go into exile, and*ld Bethel shall come to nothing.”
Seek*pn the Lord*s and live, lest*ld he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and*ld it devour, with none to quench it for Bethel,
O*ln you who turn justice to wormwood and*ld cast down righteousness to the earth!

He*pn who made the Pleiades and Orion, and*ld turns deep darkness into the morning and*ld darkens the day into night, who*ln calls for the waters of the sea and*ld pours them out on the surface of the earth, the*ln Lord*s is his name;
who*ln makes destruction flash forth against the strong, so*ld that destruction comes upon the fortress.
They*pn hate him who reproves in the gate, and*ld they abhor him who speaks the truth.

Therefore*ln because you trample on the poor and*ld you exact taxes of grain from him, you*ln have built houses of hewn stone, but*ld you shall not dwell in them; you*ln have planted pleasant vineyards, but*ld you shall not drink their wine.
For*ln I know how many are your transgressions and*ld how great are your sins— you*ln who afflict the righteous, who take a bribe, and*ld turn aside the needy in the gate.
Therefore*ln he who is prudent will keep silent in such a time, for*ld it is an evil time.
Seek*pn good, and not evil, that*ld you may live; and*ln so the Lord,*s the God of hosts, will be with you, as*ld you have said.
Hate*ln evil, and love good, and*ld establish justice in the gate; it*ln may be that the Lord,*s the God of hosts, will*ld be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.

Therefore*p thus says the Lord,*s the God of hosts, the Lord: “In*pn all the squares there shall be wailing, and*ld in all the streets they shall say, ‘Alas! Alas!’ They*ln shall call the farmers to mourning and*ld to wailing those who are skilled in lamentation,
and*ln in all vineyards there shall be wailing, for*ld I will pass through your midst,” says*l the Lord.*s
Let Justice Roll Down
Woe*pn to you who desire the day of the Lord!*s Why*ld would you have the day of the Lord?*s It*ln is darkness, and not light,
as*ld if a man fled from a lion, and*ld a bear met him, or*ln went into the house and leaned his hand against the wall, and*ld a serpent bit him.
Is*ln not the day of the Lord*s darkness, and not light, and*ld gloom with no brightness in it?
“I*pn hate, I despise your feasts, and*ld I take no delight in your solemn assemblies.
Even*ln though you offer me your burnt offerings and grain offerings, I*ld will not accept them; and*ln the peace offerings of your fattened animals, I*ld will not look upon them.
Take*ln away from me the noise of your songs; to*ld the melody of your harps I will not listen.
But*ln let justice roll down like waters, and*ld righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.
“Did*p you bring to me sacrifices and offerings during the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
You shall take up Sikkuth your king, and Kiyyun your star-god— your images that you made for yourselves,
and I will send you into exile beyond Damascus,” says the Lord,*s whose name is the God of hosts.
